result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javonte M Cotton

defendant.name: Cotton, Javonte M
defendant.address: 1542 South Cesar Chavez Drive, Milwaukee, WI 53204

records.addlTxt: Defendant appeared by video to cancel the warrant. Court ordered that the signature bond previously forfeited be reinstated.

Defendant Javonte M Cotton in court, appeared by video.  Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court by video for Javonte M Cotton.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Potter in court by video for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense Counsel informs the court that the Defendant had the wrong time for his Preliminary Hearing. Requests the previously issued warrant to be canceled and a Preliminary Hearing date. Court orders the warrant to be withdrawn and the bail to be reinstated. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Preliminary Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $10000.00

Defendant Javonte M Cotton not in court.  Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court in person for Javonte M Cotton.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant failing to appear. Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Javonte M Cotton appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defendant has not officially retained Counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status Conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Javonte M Cotton in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Javonte M Cotton appeared by video means.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT

Defendant Javonte M Cotton in court by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State request the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or in the alternative status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bond previously posted to be returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Javonte M Cotton in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/1/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on July 1, 2022, at 1:00 PM.
